text: have you ever made a Mississippi Mud Pie
I never have until today and I'm really
excited to share the recipe with you it
starts with a chocolate crust and the
chocolate crust is a cookie crumb crust
made with these chocolate wafer cookies
you'll need 25 of them grind them up so
they're fine
add some pecans this one is a pecan and
chocolate crust you grind the punch and
the chocolate cookies together till
they're
very good then you add four tablespoons
of melted unsalted butter and process
until everything is moistened these
cookie crumb cups are so great because
well a lot of the work is done for you
by using pre-made cookies well it takes
a little bit of workout which makes
baking a little bit easier besides this
one is barely baked it's gets filled
with their delicious rich chocolate
pudding that gets cooked on top of the
stove so press the crumbs firmly onto
the bottom and the sides of the pan just
needs to set and firm up that should
take about 8 to 10 minutes at 375
degrees when the crust is cool you can
get your filling ready delicious
chocolate pudding measure two thirds of
a cup of sugar into a medium saucepan
then add 1/3 of a cup of unsweetened
cocoa messy and then 1/3 of a cup of
corn starch the corn starch is going to
be your thickener
to that add a quarter teaspoon of salt
and whisk together first I'm going to
separate some eggs and then I'm going to
start cooking so you need four large
eggs you only need the yolks for this
recipe it's easiest to separate eggs
when they're cold
so take eggs directly out of the fridge
to separate now you can start cooking
two and a half cups of milk you can
gradually whisk into your dry
ingredients once the cornstarch and the
cocoa powder have dissolved you can add
your milk a little more quickly but it's
nice to get it dissolved in just a
little bit of milk it's easier to avoid
lumps that way then whisk your eggs in
you can actually whisk the eggs into the
milk if you want to and then whisk
everything in together
and then you want to cook this cook this
whisking until the first large bubbles
form and then you can turn it down to a
medium and just continue cooking it
until
really nice into fit I can feel that
it's starting just thicken already and
it hasn't even come to a boil
but for cornstarch to fully activate the
liquid actually has to be at a full boil
before it's fully activated its bubbling
it's thickened I'm going to pass it
through the sieve I do see that there
are a couple of little lumps of
chocolate in there and those will be
removed by passing it through the sieve
as well use a rubber spatula to pass it
through your sieve any little bits of
cooked egg or a little lumps of
undissolved chocolate or whatever will
just stay right in the sieve and then
you end up with a smooth silky custard
homemade pudding is so easy I don't know
why anyone uses the Box I do not
recommend replacing this with box mix
pudding I love chocolate pudding so good
add a teaspoon of pure vanilla extract
and then two tablespoons of cold
unsalted butter cut up into pieces and
stir to combine the butter adds a nice
bit of richness so silky and delightful
then grab your crust and fill it with
the pudding
Lewton bad smooth the top now if you
don't like to get a skin on your pudding
you should cover this with plastic
pressing it directly to the pie but if
you do like to have a skin on your
pudding like how I do then don't cover
it get it into the refrigerator and let
it set at least two hours and up to
overnight now it's time to eat dollop
whipped cream on top
this is lightly sweetened and have some
vanilla in it I like a nice soft whipped
cream I don't like to cover the entire
pie so that you can see the edges I
think it's more beautiful that way do
whatever you want and then sprinkle with
some pecans because well there are
pecans in the crust so why not you've
already got them use them and just like
that easy as pie Mississippi mud
you
